TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . She was represented before the Court by Mr W. Hermeliński , a lawyer practising in GPE . The respondent Government were represented by PERSON , of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant ’s father owned the so - called “ FAC ” situated in the centre of GPE and a plot of land under it . The Government submitted that PERCENT of the building had been destroyed during the Second World War .

By virtue of LAW on the Ownership and Use of Land in GPE ( dekret o własności i użytkowaniu gruntów na obszarze QUANTITY st . PERSON ) the GPE municipality ( and after DATE ORG ) became the owner of all plots of land located in GPE . The decree provided for a possibility to obtain the perpetual lease ( after DATE - temporary ownership ) of a plot of land on request .

In DATE the applicant ’s father concluded before a public notary an agreement with a certain state institution , according to which that institution was to obtain the right of use of the property upon its declaration to reconstruct the palace . The use was supposed to DATE and be followed by a CARDINAL-year lease . The ORG submitted that the agreement at issue had never been enforced because it was contrary to a number of provisions of law .

In DATE the applicant ’s father lodged , in accordance with the DATE decree , a request to be granted the right of the temporary ownership of the plot of land formerly owned by him . It was refused by a decision issued in DATE , which was served neither on him , nor on his lawyer .
In DATE the applicant ’s father died .
In DATE another decision refusing the request was issued and it was not served either .

On DATE the applicant , as the sole heir to her father ’s property ( the inheritance proceedings completed in DATE ) , filed with ORG ( urząd dzielnicowy ) a petition in which she requested the restitution of her property .
Subsequently , ORG ( ORG ) , which occupied the property , requested the administrative authorities to grant it the right of management ( zarząd ) of that property , but to no avail .
On DATE the applicant was served with the decision of DATE refusing her father the right of temporary ownership of the land .
On DATE she lodged with the GPE Governor ( wojewoda ) a request for the annulment of that decision .
On DATE ORG ( prokurator wojewódzki ) joined the proceedings , considering that in the light of the gravity of the alleged breaches of the law the participation of the prosecutor was necessary .
On DATE the applicant lodged with ORG ( PERSON ) a complaint about the inactivity of the Governor , who had failed to issue a decision concerning her request .
On DATE the court rejected the complaint , relying on ratione temporis limits on its jurisdiction .

On DATE the Minister of Construction ( minister gospodarki przestrzennej i budownictwa ) quashed the decision of DATE . He found that the impugned decision did not contain any reference to the DATE decision , whereas they concerned the same matter . The Minister further considered that the reasoning of the decision was not supported by any documents .

On DATE the Head of ORG ( kierownik urzędu rejonowego ) refused to grant the applicant the right of perpetual use ( użytkowanie wieczyste , which replaced the former temporary ownership ) of the land . He relied , inter alia , on the fact that PERCENT of the palace had been destroyed during the Second World War , thus after reconstruction it could be considered as a new building . Therefore , having reconstructed it on its own land , the ORG became that building ’s owner .

On DATE the GPE Governor quashed that decision and discontinued the proceedings , considering that they were pointless , because the request of the applicant ’s father had been already refused by the decision of DATE .

On DATE ORG allowed the applicant ’s appeal and declared the Governor ’s decision null and void as having been issued in flagrant breach of the administrative procedure . It found that the Governor had overlooked the fact that the DATE decision had probably never been served on the applicant ’s father .
On DATE the Governor quashed the decision of the Head of ORG issued on DATE and remitted the case for re - examination .
On DATE ORG sent a copy of the DATE decision to the applicant . It informed her that no acknowledgement of receipt of that decision by her father had been found .
On DATE the applicant requested the annulment of that decision .
On DATE the GPE Governor quashed the DATE decision and remitted the case for re - examination .

On DATE the Head of ORG re - examined the request lodged by the applicant ’s father in DATE . He granted the applicant the perpetual use of the land and declared that she retained the ownership of the building located there , in accordance with the DATE agreement . The Head of ORG found that a project for the future use of the building , prepared by the applicant , complied with the town planning scheme .

On DATE ORG raised an objection ( sprzeciw ) to that decision . She mentioned that the clause concerning the ownership of the building made in that decision was only of a declaratory nature , i.e. it confirmed something that had been stipulated already in the DATE decree . Following that objection the GPE Governor instituted ex officio proceedings for the annulment of that decision .
On DATE the Governor rejected an appeal against the decision of CARDINAL DATE lodged by ORG , considering that the ORG had no standing in the proceedings . ORG appealed to ORG .
On DATE the Governor stayed the enforcement proceedings in respect of the decision of CARDINAL DATE .

On DATE ORG quashed the Governor ’s decision of DATE , pointing out that the Governor , having found that ORG had no standing in the proceedings , should have issued a decision discontinuing the proceedings .

On DATE ORG withdrew her objection and subsequently the proceedings concerning the annulment of the decision of CARDINAL DATE were discontinued . However , the proceedings concerning the appeal lodged by ORG were still pending .

On DATE the Governor discontinued the appeal proceedings , relying on ORG lack of standing in the proceedings . ORG appealed that decision , submitting that the buildings occupied by it were constructed in such a way that their walls did not run along the boundary between the plots of land underneath and , therefore , the DATE decision was impossible to enforce . ORG also argued that , being a ORG - owned entity occupying the property , it should take part in the proceedings in order to ensure the proper representation of the interests of the ORG and pointed out that it was involved in administrative proceedings relating to its petitions to be granted the right of management of the disputed plot of land and the neighbouring ones .

On DATE the applicant summoned a representative of ORG to appear before a specified public notary for the purpose of concluding an agreement concerning the grant of perpetual use of the land , but to no avail .

On DATE the applicant requested ORG , before which the ORG ’s appeal against the decision of DATE was pending , to dismiss the ORG ’s petition to have the enforcement of that decision stayed . In reply , the court informed the applicant that the enforcement was stayed ex lege and there was no need to issue any specific decision in this respect .

On DATE ORG allowed ORG appeal and quashed the decision of DATE . It noted that in DATE the ORG had been granted the use of a neighbouring plot of land and , on the strength of a law enacted in DATE , became the owner of that plot . The court found that it was necessary to establish whether the plot owned by ORG overlapped the plot covered by the DATE decision . If so , the ORG should be allowed to take part in the proceedings as a party .

On DATE the Governor quashed the decision of CARDINAL DATE and remitted the case for re - examination . He pointed out that in the course of further proceedings the line of the boundary in question should be established and , consequently , it should be decided whether ORG had standing . The applicant appealed that decision to ORG , submitting that it was not necessary to remit the case for re - examination and that the Governor could have ruled on the ORG ’s rights in the proceedings himself on the basis of the material already contained by the case - file .

Meanwhile , on DATE the President of ORG ( Prezes PERSON i PERSON ) on the request of ORG instituted proceedings aimed at the annulment of the decision of DATE ( quashing the above - mentioned DATE decision ) .

On DATE the applicant lodged with ORG a complaint about the inactivity of the President of that office . She submitted that despite her CARDINAL requests to expedite the examination of the case the authority concerned had not taken any action .
On DATE the President of ORG annulled the decision of DATE . He considered that the Governor had not been competent to issue that decision .
On DATE ORG asked the applicant whether she was pursuing her complaint about inactivity , despite the fact that the authority concerned had given a decision . She withdrew her complaint .
On DATE the President of ORG , after the re - examination of the case requested by the applicant , upheld his own decision of DATE .
The applicant lodged an appeal with ORG .
The proceedings are still continuing .

In DATE the applicant enquired about the legal status of the disputed property . She received a certificate from a public notary office stating that in the land - and - mortgage register her father was mentioned as the owner of property no . CARDINAL . Although in DATE the ORG authorities requested that an entry be made in the register declaring that ORG was the owner , the request was not granted , as they failed to submit the DATE decision refusing the applicant ’s father the right to temporary ownership with a clause confirming its legal force . In DATE the proceedings concerning that request were stayed . Another entry in the register concerned the DATE decree , following which ORG became the owner of the land . The certificate contains a clause stating that it does not concern the ownership rights to the buildings located on the plot .

On DATE the public notary office refused the applicant ’s request to make an entry replacing the name of her father by her name in the land register . The office pointed out that , as long as the issue of the perpetual use was not decided , it could not make any amendments to the register .
Similar information is contained in a certificate issued on DATE by the land - and - mortgage register department of ORG ( sąd rejonowy ) .

According to LAW cases shall be handled without undue delay and the time of their examination , even if they are complex , shall not exceed DATE ( LAW ) . Having failed to comply with the time - limit prescribed by LAW , the administrative organ must , under LAW , inform the parties of that fact , explain the reasons for the delay and fix a new time - limit .
LAW provides :
“ § CARDINAL . A complaint about failure to handle a case within the time - limit set forth in LAW or fixed under Article CARDINAL can be lodged with an administrative organ of a higher level .
§ CARDINAL . [ That ] organ , having found the complaint to be well - founded , shall fix an additional time - limit for the completion of the case ... ”

Further remedies in respect of inactivity on the part of an administrative organ are provided for by the PERSON on ORG . Under LAW of that LAW a party to administrative proceedings may lodge with ORG a complaint about such inactivity .

Section CARDINAL of the PERSON provides that the ORG , having found such a complaint to be well - founded , shall oblige the administrative organ concerned to issue a decision or to perform an activity . Section CARDINAL reads in so far as relevant :

“ CARDINAL . In case of establishing that the administrative organ , to ... the inactivity of which the court ’s judgment relates , has not ... carried out that judgment , the court can decide to impose a fine on that organ . ...

CARDINAL . In the instance referred to in LAW the court can , in addition , rule on the existence or non - existence of a right or obligation , if the nature of the case and its uncontested facts ... make this possible .

CARDINAL . The court shall apply the provisions of § § CARDINAL and CARDINAL in case of granting a complaint lodged by an entitled entity , which has previously applied to the organ concerned with a written notice to carry out the court ’s judgment .
CARDINAL . A compensation claim is vested in a person sustaining damage as a result of failure to carry out the court ’s judgment ... ”

LAW of the PERSON on ORG sets out the requirement of the exhaustion of available remedies before lodging a complaint with that court . Accordingly , a complaint concerning alleged inactivity should be preceded by the lodging of a complaint with an administrative organ of a higher level , pursuant to the above - mentioned LAW . In its case - law ORG has stated that that requirement does not apply to complaints concerning the inactivity of administrative organs of the highest level , such as the President of ORG ( see ORG judgment of DATE , no . I ORG CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .

According to the Decree of DATE on the Ownership and Use of Land in GPE ( dekret o własności i użytkowaniu gruntów na obszarze QUANTITY st . PERSON ) the ownership of all land was transferred to the municipality . The decree provided in so far as relevant :

“ LAW Buildings and other objects located on the land being transferred to the municipality ’s ownership remain the property of those who have owned them so far , unless specific provisions provide otherwise .

Article CARDINAL . ( CARDINAL ) The owner of a plot of land ( ... ) can within DATE after the taking of possession of the land by the municipality file a request to be granted ( ... ) the right to a perpetual lease ( wieczysta dzierżawa ) with a peppercorn rent ( czynsz symboliczny ) . ...
( CARDINAL ) The municipality shall grant the request if the use of the land by the former owner is compatible with its function set forth in the development plan ( plan zabudowania ) . ...

( CARDINAL ) In case the request is refused , the municipality shall offer the person entitled , as long as it has spare land in its possession , the perpetual lease of land of equal value to use , on the same conditions , or the right to construct on such land .

( CARDINAL ) In case no request , as provided for in paragraph ( CARDINAL ) , is filed , or the former owner is for any other reasons not granted a perpetual lease or the right to construct , the municipality is obliged to pay compensation pursuant to LAW .

Article CARDINAL . In case the former owner is not granted the right to a perpetual lease or the right to construct , all buildings located on the land become the property of the municipality , which is obliged to pay , pursuant to article CARDINAL , compensation for the buildings which are fit to be used or renovated .
Article CARDINAL . ... ( CARDINAL ) The right to compensation begins to apply DATE after DATE of taking the land into possession by the municipality of GPE and expires DATE after that date . ... ”

According to article ORG of the Decree of DATE introducing LAW ( prawo rzeczowe ) and LAW , the right to construct and the right to a perpetual lease could be transferred into temporary ownership ( własność czasowa ) .
Section CARDINAL of the Law of DATE on ORG ( ustawa o gospodarce terenami w miastach i osiedlach ) replaced temporary ownership with perpetual use ( użytkowanie wieczyste ) .

The right to perpetual use is regulated by LAW . An individual or a legal entity may be granted such a right on land owned by the ORG or local self - government . The right comprises a right to use the land to the exclusion of others for DATE , on payment of a yearly fee . A person entitled to the right can dispose of it .

In DATE there was enacted the PERSON on Transforming Perpetual Use Vested in Individuals into Ownership ( ustawa o przekształceniu prawa użytkowania wieczystego przysługującego osobom fizycznym w prawo własności ) . The law guarantees individuals who acquired perpetual use of property before DATE the right to have that right transformed into ownership . LAW ( CARDINAL ) of that law provides that individuals who acquired the right to perpetual lease LAW decree are entitled to such transformation free of charge , regardless of when they acquired their right to a perpetual lease . Requests for the transformation could be submitted until DATE .
